tasks.description: Identify the bar segments representing 'Gold' medals in the chart legend.

steps.aoiDescription: Locate the entire area containing the legend that identifies the medal types (Gold, Silver, Bronze).
Identify the legend entry for 'Gold' medals, using its color as a visual cue to locate matching segments in the chart.
Locate all gold-colored bar segments that correspond to 'Gold' medals in each country's stacked bar.

tasks.description: Identify a country on the x-axis.
tasks.label: U.S.A.

steps.aoiDescription: Locate the entire area containing the x-axis labels for all countries.
Identify the x-axis label 'U.S.A.' by referencing the bar's horizontal extent directly above it.
Visually trace a vertical path upward from the 'U.S.A.' label to reach the stacked bar directly above it.
Focus on the gold-colored bar segment for 'U.S.A.', representing the gold medals awarded.

tasks.description: Determine the bottom boundary of the 'Gold' segment for the country.
tasks.label: U.S.A.

steps.aoiDescription: Trace a vertical line upward from the 'U.S.A.' label to reach the gold medal segment directly above it.
Locate the gold medal bar segment for 'U.S.A.' to identify its bottom boundary.
Focus on the bottom edge of the gold medal segment, which visually represents the starting point of the 'Gold' count for 'U.S.A.'.
Visually scan horizontally from the bottom of the gold segment to the y-axis to read the corresponding value.

tasks.description: Determine the top boundary of the 'Gold' segment for the country.
tasks.label: U.S.A.

steps.aoiDescription: Trace a vertical line upward from the 'U.S.A.' label to reach the gold medal segment directly above it.
Locate the gold medal bar segment for 'U.S.A.' to identify its top boundary.
Focus on the top edge of the gold medal segment, which visually represents where the 'Gold' segment begins for 'U.S.A.'.
Visually scan horizontally from the top of the gold segment to the y-axis to read the corresponding value.

tasks.description: Calculate the proportion of 'Gold' medals by subtracting the bottom boundary from the top boundary.
tasks.label: U.S.A.

steps.aoiDescription: Locate the top edge of the 'Gold' segment for 'U.S.A.' and trace a horizontal line to the y-axis.
Locate the bottom edge of the 'Gold' segment for 'U.S.A.' and trace a horizontal line to the y-axis.

steps.stepName: Vertical Reference Line AOI (Gold Segment Height)
steps.aoiDescription: Draw a vertical line along the y-axis from the top to bottom boundary to visually represent the proportion of gold medals.

steps.aoiDescription: Locate the top edge of the 'Gold' segment for 'Great Britain' and trace a horizontal line to the y-axis.
Locate the bottom edge of the 'Gold' segment for 'Great Britain' and trace a horizontal line to the y-axis.

steps.aoiDescription: Draw a vertical line along the y-axis from the top to bottom boundary to visually represent the proportion of gold medals for 'Great Britain'.

tasks.description: Find the country with the minimum proportion of 'Gold' medals among all calculated proportions.

steps.aoiDescription: Trace horizontal lines from the y-axis to each country's gold medal segment height to visually compare their proportions.
Highlight the smallest gold segment height among all countries to visually confirm the minimum proportion — Great Britain.
Highlight the x-axis label that corresponds to the country with the minimum gold medal proportion.
